The beacon bubble particles are unnecessary and distracting. Please remove them - or at make them toggleable. 

After making the effort to gather the resources and build a Beacon in my home base - I quickly turned off the effect because the bubbles are so annoying. They block vision and create a distraction -- the effect badge on the right of the screen is sufficient.
I second this.
Particles give me headaches.  Can't have a beacon at my base because particles are so annoying.

Absolutely. There‚Äôs absolutely no point in activating beacons or conduits when spirals are constantly covering your face. I don‚Äôt know if there‚Äôs a toggle for this on PC, but on my PS4 I have no options in regards to this. Imagine taking a screenshot in first person and theirs spirals blocking your entire screen.
Yes! OMG! This is THE MOST ANNOYING thing about Bedrock edition! PLEASE make this go away! PLEASE üôè

I agree that the particle effects are annoying. I get why they exist, though, which is why I think that you should just be able to turn them off if you don't want them in the video settings. At the very least, please tone them down a lot. Instead of a constant swirl of particles around you, blocking your vision, maybe just the occasional once particle at a time here and there.

This needs to be toggleable for beacons and potions, the display in the top right corner is enough. I worked so hard to get a beacon and now I can't use it bc of the particles making me dizzy and nauseas.

Popping in to say that this is still very much an issue. Minecraft seems to really care when it comes to accessibility -- to continue that trend, these effects truly need to be toggleable. Multiple folks here, as well as myself, have health issues associated with the beacon / potion particles. I would love to be able to fully play the game with the beacons I've acquired, without feeling dizzy and sick.
Please remove the beacon particles and extend the visibility of its ray: I can't see it just 100-150 blocks away from it!

Yes, as now we know that the 1.18 terrain is going to be HUGE... like big landscapes, so I think that a higher render distance would be needed to FULLY enjoy that terrain

This is a great idea. But combine it with a curved horizon instead of rendering out and infinite plan. There was an old N64 game called Tetrisphere. The game looks like you were peeling away layers of a sphere but the layout was actually a flat plan with vanishing points tweaked to look like a sphere. Minecraft could do a much less severe version of this to reduce rendering distance in a way that mimics real life.
Add level of detail Mojang

To the people arguing to "just buy better computers" that's not available for everyone. For me, without Optifine I couldn't last minutes in a singleplayer world because of the sheer lag, and the only way to prevent it was to look at the ground, which is pretty odd.

Players shouldn't have to buy new computers to play a game which is based on the concept of blocks with low graphics

Blocks such as lava, water and sea lanterns, among other blocks and items, already have animated textures. It's pulled off by stacking individual frames on top of each other in the image file. With that in mind, I have a potential solution, although it might take up more space, as well as some technical know-how. Have a standard skin file, and any body part that needs to be animated would require it's own separate file, layered similar to the above mentioned blocks. Technically speaking, that would potentially mean if every piece was animated, both the base and outer layers, would total 12 files. The standard skin on those parts would be transparent to accommodate these files, and anything static would still be there. It's a lot to suggest, but hopefully it makes sense
The possibilities would be endless
Truly

I like
I find this would be a great addition! Banners would look way better!
There should be an option to toggle this, perhaps by adding paper to the shield. I only say this because some people already have patterns with the low res in mind
This is a must. Half the time I create a cool looking banner it gets ruined when I put it on my shield.

What you're suggesting could make a cylinder, but that's not the same as making it a planet.  Making it a planet would mean it's spherical, and you can't make a sphere out of a flat surface.  For what you're proposing to be reasonable, you would have to be able to walk in any direction and get back to where you started.

The other issue is the world gen isn't going to be seamless, at least not with the simple stitch together you're proposing.  You might be able to travel across the border, but it's going to be very obvious.

 

This would be absolutely amazing as a finite world, but to be seamless and smooth it would require a severe tweaking to world generation.  I honestly don't know how much it would take to make a seamless, spherical minecraft world.

I think a toroidal world was an old reddit suggestion? If both X and Z coordinates behaved like that. And that it would be usefull for most players if you could decide the size of that world in incroments of world save file sizes. It should probably apply to both overworld and nether, but not the end?

I like the intent behind this idea. Adding world wrap in all four directions would make it a torus-shaped world which is okay if that's what you want.

If you want a cylinder world, the world border could be turned on just for X or just for Z.

Or, if X had world wrap at ¬±15 707 963, and Z had world border at ¬±159 154, this would give the Minecraft world nearly the exact surface area of the original Halo.

If Z was limited to ¬±N (where N is a few thousands, ten thousands, hundred thousands, or whatever) and X had world wrap at 2xN, the world would be a cylinder but a little more realistic in its dimensions, like a flat world projection. (It would require a whole lot of extra game design to make a Minecraft world into a true sphere, so this would be easier.)

Shouldn't be to hard to create a toroidal world (integer overflow). As for the seamless part,
easy solution is to make the upper/lower max coordinates an ocean to take care of the wrapping.
You could set the world's negative zero (e.g. -32768) to always be a fixed pattern ocean and blend the ocean against the biomes on the ajacent chunks (e.g. +32767 and -32767) 

World size should be a setting (upon creation only, like the seed) 65535 (+32767 to -32768) seems like a nice default size.

Also, Minecraft worlds being toroidal would (kind of) explain why minecraft gravity is so strange :)
The New one just isn't as useful and i agree that its just shoving MINECRAFT REALMS into peoples face (plus the old one was just somewhat nostalgic)
I really hope they add an option for this

Well this is a great idea for realism but the problem is that you can catch a lot more than just fish in Minecraft. How would this work for catching, say, a bone, or an enchanted book?

I forgot to put that in; the animation would only be for fish: cod, salmon, tropical, but for bones and inc sacs it would just be the normal animation. In a nutshell, the animation is only for the fish part, not any other items (junk or treasure).

I love the idea, but what about items as well? Let‚Äôs say a piece of read is floating on the top of the water. Wouldn‚Äôt it be cool if you could hook the fishing rod to the ITEM as well? Just a suggestion

Fish could have eaten the items, so when you reel in a fish there is a chance that you get an item as well. On the other hand, you could do what Bohan Zhang said and have it only be for fish. That way, if a fish attaches itself to it, you know that you will not get an item

I wouldn't expect this to fly as requested. Redstone builds rely on those animation speeds. For example a minecart pezz dispenser needs a gate with a one tic pulse. If they adjust the speed of animation they will need to check the tic speed on the open value. Could be done. Just opens the door, pun intended, for more glitches or reduced capabilities if not fully worked out. Good start. Keep working on it!
Animations could be very quick, and could also just be aesthetic, but we may want them for doors only, as people will occasionally spam-click (tap) levers for fun, and that could be broken.
